results.abstract: 600 school children fly kites in annual contest, Somers, NY; illus

headline.main: March Blusters In With Covey of Kites; The Rocket Kite: A New Contender in the Space Race

results.snippet: SOMERS, N.Y., March 1-- March came in with coveys of kites skittering overhead here today in a brisk 20-milean-hour wind. Some were disguised as rockets, others as Superman, fish, elephants, birds, battleships, jet planes and astronaut's capsules.

byline.original: By MERRILL FOLSOM Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: SOMERS, N.Y., March 1-- March came in with coveys of kites skittering overhead here today in a brisk 20-milean-hour wind. Some were disguised as rockets, others as Superman, fish, elephants, birds, battleships, jet planes and astronaut's capsules.

results.abstract: Study group organized by Natl Research Council Space Science Bd urges research into filling astronauts' lungs with liquid to enable them to withstand high acceleration over long periods of time; studies have shown some animals can survive for periods in heavily oxygenated salt water; group urges study of nitrogen-oxygen in spacecraft because body may need nitrogen compound over long periods of time; urges studies of fire prevention, carbon dioxide tolerance and med to be used on flights

headline.main: Scientists Study Breathing of Liquid in Space

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 4-- Astronauts may deliberately fill their lungs with liquid at crucial times in some long-range space flights of the future, a new report suggests.

byline.original: By HAROLD M. SCHMECK Jr. Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 4-- Astronauts may deliberately fill their lungs with liquid at crucial times in some long-range space flights of the future, a new report suggests.

results.abstract: NASA officials see no manned flight before Feb; see chances for meeting '70 deadline for manned landing on moon slim

headline.main: SPACE TRIPS IN '67 APPEAR UNLIKELY; First Manned Apollo Flight Faces Delay Till February

results.snippet: No American astronauts are likely to fly in space this year, and the chances of a manned landing on the moon in this decade, the original Apollo goal, are now considered slim.
results.lead_paragraph: No American astronauts are likely to fly in space this year, and the chances of a manned landing on the moon in this decade, the original Apollo goal, are now considered slim.

results.abstract: R Baker links Powell's troubles to inability to conform to pub demand that politicians, like champ boxers, be humble in pub

headline.main: Observer: Powell and Ali Break the Faith

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 4-- Perhaps Adam Clayton Powell's most damaging weakness is his inability to assume the humble manner. The distinguished heavyweight, Mohammad Ali, suffers from the same defect. Ability to wear the trappings of humility is an...
results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 4-- Perhaps Adam Clayton Powell's most damaging weakness is his inability to assume the humble manner. The distinguished heavyweight, Mohammad Ali, suffers from the same defect. Ability to wear the trappings of humility is an occupational requirement in certain lines of work--particularly in politics and championship boxing--and he who scorns them invites the vengeance of an outraged public.

results.abstract: Environmental Services Adm operates Space Disturbance Forecast Center, Boulder, Colo, to warn of radiation danger from solar flares to supersonic transports

headline.main: NETWORK SET UP ON SOLAR FLARES; Scientists Give Daily Data to Ease Radiation Peril

results.snippet: Crewmen and passengers on space flights and very high altitude jets are facing a radiation hazard that has prompted three Federal agencies to join in a program to provide daily forecasts of the weather on the sun's surface.
results.lead_paragraph: Crewmen and passengers on space flights and very high altitude jets are facing a radiation hazard that has prompted three Federal agencies to join in a program to provide daily forecasts of the weather on the sun's surface.

results.abstract: Cosmos 146 separates into 2 spacecraft; US officials deny London press rept that it may be largest craft ever launched, say radar may have tracked 2 craft and final stage of launching rocket; craft are due to re-enter atmosphere in few days
results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 17-- A large Soviet spacecraft has separated into two spacecraft in orbit in what may be a test for a manned flight, American space officials said today.

byline.original: By EVERT CLARK Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 17-- A large Soviet spacecraft has separated into two spacecraft in orbit in what may be a test for a manned flight, American space officials said today.

results.abstract: Capt V Nikolayeva-Tereshkova says Vostok capsules have quick-opening explosive hatches and jet-propelled ejection seats

headline.main: Soviet Astronaut Describes Escape Methods on Vostok

results.abstract: NASA repts active astronaut training suspended until impact of Jan fire can be assessed; no crew assignments made for 1st manned flight; expected design changes leave astronauts with no simulators for training; most are assigned to other duties; investigators' rept on fire due in Apr; Repr Teague sets HR subcom hearing; full-scale Cong investigation planned

headline.main: NASA SUSPENDS APOLLO TRAINING FOR ASTRONAUTS; Space Assignments Are Off Till Impact of Fire Is Clear  House Inquiry Slated NASA Suspends the Apollo Training

results.snippet: Active training of astronaut crews for the nation's space program has been suspended until the full impact of the Apollo spacecraft fire last January can be assessed, space agency officials said yesterday.
results.lead_paragraph: Active training of astronaut crews for the nation's space program has been suspended until the full impact of the Apollo spacecraft fire last January can be assessed, space agency officials said yesterday.

headline.main: News Summary and Index; The Major Events of the Day International National Metropolitan

results.snippet: Rockefeller and Legis leaders fail to agree

results.abstract: Editorial urges Adm use pause in race to moon to re-evaluate space program
results.snippet: A slowdown in the frenzied race to put a man on the moon seems to be taking place. No Soviet astronaut has gone into space for more than two years, while no Americans are to be sent into orbit until early next year, or even later.
results.lead_paragraph: A slowdown in the frenzied race to put a man on the moon seems to be taking place. No Soviet astronaut has gone into space for more than two years, while no Americans are to be sent into orbit until early next year, or even later.

headline.main: Out of the Bathtub and Into a Pucci Print Towel

results.snippet: COME September, a woman will be able to step right from the tub into an Emilio Pucci print. The Florentine fashion designer's first collection of bathroom linens, for Springmaid, will be in stores in early fall.
results.lead_paragraph: COME September, a woman will be able to step right from the tub into an Emilio Pucci print. The Florentine fashion designer's first collection of bathroom linens, for Springmaid, will be in stores in early fall.
